text: Harold Demsetz (; May 31, 1930 â€“ January 4, 2019) was an American economist. He was a professor of economics at the University of California at Los Angeles (UCLA). Demsetz was a fellow of the American Academy of Arts and Sciences, a director of the Mont Pelerin Society, and a past (1996) president of the Western Economics Association. He was known for his works in the Nirvana fallacy. Demsetz died on January 4, 2019 at the age of 88.In Memoriam: Harold Demsetz, 1930-2019 ==References== Category:1930 births Category:2019 deaths Category:American economists Category:Scientists from Chicago Category:Writers from Chicago
title: Harold Demsetz
